    • Constructor Detail

      • Genome

        public Genome(int numInput,
              int numOutput,
              InnovationTracker it)
       throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Creates a new genome with the specified number of input and output nodes. Creates one connection for every sensor/output pair. Automatically includes an extra input node to account for the bias node.

        Note: for ease of implementation, these genomes will only have one bias node, which is treated as an input node. It is always at index 0 of nodeGenes.

        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

    • Method Detail

      • evaluate

        public float[] evaluate(float[] input)
        Takes some input and evaluates this genome as a feed-forward neural network to provide some output. Note: for ease of implementation, there is only one bias node, which is treated as an input node. This bias node is always at index 0.

      • addConnectionMutation

        public boolean addConnectionMutation(InnovationTracker it)
        Adds a new connection from a non-output node to a non-sensor/bias node
        Returns:
        whether or not the mutation was successful

      • addNodeMutation

        public boolean addNodeMutation(InnovationTracker it)
        Adds a new node by replacing an existing connection
        Returns:
        whether or not the mutation was successful

      • printToposort

        public void printToposort()
        A debug tool that prints the nodes of this genome, layer by layer, in a segmented toposort-like manner.

      • copy

        public Genome copy()
        Creates a new Genome that has no references in common with "this" but has all the same values, apart from fitnessHasBeenSet (initialized to false) and fitness (not initialized).

        public float getRawFitness()
        Returns this genome's fitness, not adjusting for what species it is part of.

      • setFitness

        public void setFitness(float f)
                throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Sets the fitness of this genome. It can only called once per object.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException

      • getToposort

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer>> getToposort()
        Returns an array list of layers of this genome (interpereted as a neural net). I.e. All nodes with no input edges are in getToposort().get(0). Each node is represented by its index in the genome.

      • getEnabledConnectionsAsPoints

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.awt.Point> getEnabledConnectionsAsPoints()
        Returns an ArrayList of all enabled connection genes, each represented by a Point object.

      • getConnectionGenes

        public java.util.List<ConnectionGene> getConnectionGenes()

      • crossover

        public static Genome crossover(Genome p1,
                               Genome p2)
        Gateway function to the proteced crossover function. Please see its javadoc The parameters of this function do not need any special order. I.e. either p1 or p2 may be the more fit parent
        Parameters:
        p1 - one parent
        p2 - the other parent

      • crossover

        protected static Genome crossover(Genome p1,
                                  Genome p2,
                                  boolean equal)
        Creates and returns an entirely new genome by choosing between the genes of the two parents. All genes chosen from parents are copied before being added to the child, so the child is totally separate from p1 and p2. That is, child, p1, and p2 will NOT share any references. O(n+m+q) where n is p1.connectionGenes.size(), m is p2.connectionGenes.size(), and q is the number of node genes that child inherits.
        Parameters:
        p1 - The more fit parent
        p2 - The less fit parent
        equal - true if both parents are equally fit

      • delta

        public static float delta(Genome genome1,
                          Genome genome2,
                          float c1,
                          float c2,
                          float c3)
        returns the "compatibility" of genome1 and genome2, only considering connection genes
